page.title: 19RELIGION IN TYSOE
page.content: The village has two main places of worship - an ancient Anglican church and a modern Methodist chapel. A former Plymouth Brethren meeting house is now disused. The village falls within the Catholic parish of Ilmington, the priest being Father Keniry, but the few Catholic villagers mainly attend worship at the nearer churches of Brailes, Kineton, or Shipston. The large parish church dates from at least the eleventh century, and has some fine architectural features. The Vicar is the Rev. I. Lilley, who has two other parishes, but lives at Tysoe. There is a church choir. The chapel, replacing an older building, was built in 1970, and has rooms attached where a Sunday School meets. The Minister is the Rev. D.F. Clarke of Wesley Manse, Kineton.
